1.text: Truly, truly, I say to you, He that enters not by the door into the sheepfold, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.

2.text: But he that enters in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

3.text: To him the porter opens; and the sheep hear his voice: and he calls his own sheep by name, and leads them out.

4.text: And when he puts forth his own sheep, he goes before them, and the sheep follow him: for they know his voice.

5.text: And a stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him: for they know not the voice of strangers.

6.text: This parable spoke Jesus to them: but they understood not what things they were which he spoke to them.

7.text: Then said Jesus to them again, Truly, truly, I say to you, I am the door of the sheep.

8.text: All that ever came before me are thieves and robbers: but the sheep did not hear them.

9.text: I am the door: by me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.

10.text: The thief comes not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to destroy: I am come that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly.

11.text: I am the good shepherd: the good shepherd gives his life for the sheep.

12.text: But he that is an hireling, and not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, sees the wolf coming, and leaves the sheep, and flees: and the wolf catches them, and scatters the sheep.

13.text: The hireling flees, because he is an hireling, and cares not for the sheep.

14.text: I am the good shepherd, and know my sheep, and am known of mine.

15.text: As the Father knows me, even so know I the Father: and I lay down my life for the sheep.

16.text: And other sheep I have, which are not of this fold: them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one fold, and one shepherd.

17.text: Therefore does my Father love me, because I lay down my life, that I might take it again.

18.text: No man takes it from me, but I lay it down of myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. This commandment have I received of my Father.

19.text: There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings.

20.text: And many of them said, He has a devil, and is mad; why hear you him?

21.text: Others said, These are not the words of him that has a devil. Can a devil open the eyes of the blind?

22.text: And it was at Jerusalem the feast of the dedication, and it was winter.

23.text: And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon’s porch.

24.text: Then came the Jews round about him, and said to him, How long do you make us to doubt? If you be the Christ, tell us plainly.

25.text: Jesus answered them, I told you, and you believed not: the works that I do in my Father’s name, they bear witness of me.

26.text: But you believe not, because you are not of my sheep, as I said to you.

27.text: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:

28.text: And I give to them eternal life; and they shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand.

29.text: My Father, which gave them me, is greater than all; and no man is able to pluck them out of my Father’s hand.

30.text: I and my Father are one.

31.text: Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him.

32.text: Jesus answered them, Many good works have I showed you from my Father; for which of those works do you stone me?

33.text: The Jews answered him, saying, For a good work we stone you not; but for blasphemy; and because that you, being a man, make yourself God.

34.text: Jesus answered them, Is it not written in your law, I said, You are gods?

35.text: If he called them gods, to whom the word of God came, and the scripture cannot be broken;

36.text: Say you of him, whom the Father has sanctified, and sent into the world, You blaspheme; because I said, I am the Son of God?

37.text: If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not.

38.text: But if I do, though you believe not me, believe the works: that you may know, and believe, that the Father is in me, and I in him.

39.text: Therefore they sought again to take him: but he escaped out of their hand,

40.text: And went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized; and there he stayed.

41.text: And many resorted to him, and said, John did no miracle: but all things that John spoke of this man were true.

42.text: And many believed on him there.
